description: Construction of two-storey building with basement level to provide seven self-contained flats (2 x 1 bed, 2 x 2 bed and 3 x 3 bed) with associated communal amenity space, car parking, refuse and cycle storage (following demolition of existing dwellinghouse)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 17-028-P01, 17-028-P02, 17-028-P03, 17-028-P04, 17-028-P05, 17-028-P06, 17-028-P07, 17-028-P08, 17-028-P09, 17-028-P10, 17-028-P11, 17-028-P12.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Cycle storage in line with the details approved under Condition 2 shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently. Cycle parking shall comply with the London Cycling Design Standards.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development and to provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.16 and 6.9 of the London Plan (2016).

| Refuse and recycling storage shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently in accordance with the details approved under Condition 2 of this permission.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).

| The privacy screens separating the amenity spaces within the hereby approved development shall be implemented fully prior to occupation of the development and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013).
| 7	Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Logistics Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
o	Construction traffic management proposals including details of delivery routes and HGV movements and details of any temporary site access/parking;
o	Details of construction hours;
o	Noise mitigation and monitoring measures;
o	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
o	Details of temporary lighting;
o	Dust suppression and monitoring measures, having regard to BRE guide 'Control of Dust from Construction and Demolition Activities';
o	Wheel wash measures;- Site security during construction;

o	A drainage strategy to operate setting out controls of contamination, including controls to surface water run-off, water pumping, storage of fuels and hazardous materials, spill response plans and pollution control measures; and
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Logistics Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of site preparation and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 5.14 and 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.

| Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation, for the installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh.  The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to first occupation, for the installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of less than 0.030 g/kWh.  The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained
Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval of external noise levels from transport and industrial and/ or commercial sources and details of the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building) to achieve internal room- and (if provided) external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from transport, industrial and/or commercial noise sources, in accordance with Policies3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'; and Local Variation policy 3.5 of the Ealing's draft Development Management Plan Document.

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedroom adjacent to staircase, living/dining room and kitchen above/below bedroom of separate dwellings. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'; and Local Variation policy 3.5 of the Ealing's draft Development Management Plan Document.

| The existing detached rear outbuilding shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the development hereby approved, and shall not be used for habitable accommodation, as an independent dwelling or any industrial, commercial or business use.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
